      • processPayment

        void processPayment​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Processes the payment when the 'Process Payment' button is clicked. Validates the payment information and navigates to the confirmation screen if validation passes.
        Parameters:
        event - The action event that triggers the payment process.

        Returns:

        Returns:

        Returns:

      • setupTextField

        private void setupTextField​(javafx.scene.control.TextField currentField,
                            javafx.scene.control.TextField nextField)
        Configures a text field for credit card input, enforcing numerical input and automatic focus management. This method ensures that each text field only accepts digits and automatically moves the focus to the next field once the user has entered 4 digits, facilitating a smooth and efficient input process for the credit card number. If the text field is the last in the sequence (i.e., nextField is null), it does not attempt to move focus further.
        Parameters:
        currentField - The text field currently being configured. This field will accept only digit characters and is limited to a maximum of 4 digits.
        nextField - The next text field to focus on once the currentField is fully populated. If currentField is the last in the sequence, this parameter should be null.

        public void initialize()

      • handleCloseRequest

        public void handleCloseRequest​(javafx.stage.WindowEvent event)
        Description copied from class: AbstractScreen
        This method is activated after the X is clicked on the window. The default is to show a Confirmation Alert with "Yes" and "No" options for the user to choose. "Yes" will check if the client is connected to the server, disconnect it if necessary and close the window. "No" will "consume" the request, meaning it will cancel the closing request and will keep the window open. This method can be overriden for different implementations.
        Overrides:
        handleCloseRequest in class AbstractScreen
        Parameters:
        event - the event of clicking on the X of the window

      • getScreenTitle

        public java.lang.String getScreenTitle()
        Returns the title of the screen.
        Specified by:
        getScreenTitle in class AbstractScreen
        Returns:
        A string representing the title of the Payment Screen.
